text: <@U11HH3P7Y> any update on the pipeline work for base image?
id really love to get that operational
I have submitted patch <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1237/>
I have tested this in sandbox environment and it's working fine.. As mentioned in commit message, we have manually trigger (fabric-baseimage-x86_64) job to trigger further release jobs in pipeline
<@U11HH3P7Y> ty, i just responded

I have configured those jobs using JJB setup.. Click on any Release job <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/sandbox/job/fabric-baseimage-release2-x86_64/> (modified builders for these jobs.. It just executes echo statements to see the result quickly)
merged
<@U11HH3P7Y> can you please verify the readthedocs fix here is correct <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1291/>
yes that is correct.. I too submitted another patch <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1319/>
since those are both documentation related in the future just use [ci skip] and manually verify it
unless we’re actually processing the mkdocs.yml as part of the build chain, we’d never hit it
<https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric-baseimage/>
sure I forgot to apply this time..
<@U11HH3P7Y> ok, I abandoned my change
<@U0UHG4VP1>: can you please give read access to user "bmos299" on Jenkins Sandbox
Who is that?
Barry
Added
Thank you
What project is <@U11HTMW0H> working on? The image pushing?
I only ask for my curiosity, I don't need to know
He is from Quality (testing ) team.
He want to see one of the test job result in Sandbox
<@U11HH3P7Y> thanks for setting up the pipeline…ill test it in a bit
one suggestion: I think the unqualified jobs need “-docker” added
e.g. merge-x86_64 -> merge-docker-x86_64
and “fabric-baseimage-x86_64” should really be “fabric-baseimage-release-trigger"
or something like that
sure will do that later
note that the release trigger should not have an $arch…the intention is that the release trigger will fire off all jobs on all arches
yes.. If I don't give $arch, node name in that specific job is showing as ["x86_64"] some parsing error. but in next patch will remove the $arch from release trigger job
